Text: FW RE Engines and GF StatusHere is the agencies opinion on your project at Spraberry How do you feel about testing one of those engines Jon Original Message From Duncan Stewart SMTP Sent Monday August PM To Cc Jim Linville James Randall Subject Fwd RE Engines and GF Status FYI Jim Linville PM IF there is no increase in emissions this is probably not a modification and the Grandfathered status would remain They would need to demonstrate that there is no change This could require testing before and after the change Duncan Stewart PM What say you all
Red Rock ExpansionFlagstaff Permitdoc Flagstaffxls Kingman Permitdoc Kingmanxls

FW Martin Co Cc willshuttCampbell Attached is the PTE analysis for Martin Co using data provided by Ruth Jensen The PTE for CO is approximately tpy This is using the AP factors for cycle rich engines operating at less than load This PTE analysis is very close to the Title V limits CLose enough to warrant verification of all parameters As you recall AP factors for cycle rich burns used to be ghphr for equal NOx equal CO operations The AP engine factors were revised in which resulted in a big increase in CO emissions If you use the current AP factors for load we bust tpy for CO Jon E Fields REM Argent Consulting Services Inc Ph Fx Original Message From Jensen Ruth mailto Sent Monday October PM To Cc Campbell Larry Subject RE Martin Co The information that is in my database is as follows Martin Co Unit HP Waukesha LG Btu LHVhphr Martin Co Unit HP Superior TG Btu LHVhphr You should double check this information with the field Ruth Original Message From Jon Fields mailto Sent Monday October PM To Jensen Ruth Cc Campbell Larry Subject Martin Co Ms Jensen Do you have the correct heat rates Btuhphr for the two engines at the Martin Co station in Texas Jon E Fields REM Argent Consulting Services Inc Ph Fx This email is the property of Enron Corp andor its relevant affiliate and may contain confidential and privileged material for the sole use of the intended recipient s Any review use distribution or disclosure by others is strictly prohibited If you are not the intended recipient or authorized to receive for the recipient please contact the sender or reply to Enron Corp at and delete all copies of the message This email and any attachments hereto are not intended to be an offer or an acceptance and do not create or evidence a binding and enforceable contract between Enron Corp or any of its affiliates and the intended recipient or any other party and may not be relied on by anyone as the basis of a contract by estoppel or otherwise Thank you PTE Calcsxls

Station and ReviewCampbell Argent has reviewed the draft permits for stations and Comments are attached The permits are identical and our comments are also the same for both permits Jon E Fields REM Argent Consulting Services Inc Ph Fx Klagetoh Permit Review Memodoc Leupp Permit Review Memodoc

RE Transwestern permitsI removed the watermark Otherwise when you print them you still cant see through the watermark Original Message From mailto Sent Tuesday October AM To Subject Transwestern permits Forwarded by Larry CampbellETSEnron on AM Shudeish Mahadev on PM To Richard Baker Prabhat Bhargava Eric Massey Cathy OConnell O Latha Toopal Nancy Wrona cc Subject Transwestern permits Hi team I am dispatching the permits to Larry Campbell of Enron Thought i would cc you all I see nothing but Word Perfect characters right now so i am gonna go home and fix myself a tall cool one Adios Shudeish Mahadev P F See attached file Perwpd See attached file Techwpd See attached file Perwpd See attached file Techwpd This email is the property of Enron Corp andor its relevant affiliate and may contain confidential and privileged material for the sole use of the intended recipient s Any review use distribution or disclosure by others is strictly prohibited If you are not the intended recipient or authorized to receive for the recipient please contact the sender or reply to Enron Corp at and delete all copies of the message This email and any attachments hereto are not intended to be an offer or an acceptance and do not create or evidence a binding and enforceable contract between Enron Corp or any of its affiliates and the intended recipient or any other party and may not be relied on by anyone as the basis of a contract by estoppel or otherwise Thank you PerRevdoc PerREvdoc TechRevdoc TechRevdoc

Kingman ReviewCampbell Here is my review of the Kingman Class I permit Please review my review of the transition period operating hour limitations If my logic is correct I cant see why ADEQ would limit us to hours per engine Using their numbers it appears to me that allowing us to operate hours as originally requested would not cause an exceedance in the PSD levels Let me know if you have any additional comments Im reviewing the Flagstaff permit now Jon E Fields REM Argent Consulting Services Inc Ph Fx Kingman Permit Review Memodoc

Flagstaff ReviewCampbell Here is the Flagstaff review There seems to be some confusion with the ADEQ regarding the generator engines There is no need to accept a hour limitation Jon E Fields REM Argent Consulting Services Inc Ph Fx Flagstaff Permit Review Memodoc

RE TW Comments to air permits for Stat and This looks like all of the comments Jon Original Message From mailto Sent Tuesday October PM To Subject TW Comments to air permits for Stat and Jon and Ruth presented below are the comments to the air perimts at and Please review for clairty and content I have spoken to Roger Kohn about all of these issues and the only one which may be a problem is with No He is checking on what the EPA can do about this I have spoken to Arnold Eisenstein about what we can do with the strict ppmvd requriement for NOx and CO and he has said that we can hold to the ppm value by doing some major gas recycling This is a fuel waste and costly Anyway depending upon how long this issue delays the issuance of the permit will undoubtably determine whether we give in to the ppmvd or hold out for ppmvd Id like your comments asap The responsible official name change to Danny Pribble The draft permit limits NOx and CO emissions to ppmv at O based on a hour average except during periods of startup and shutdown At F and above the GE data indicates that these rates are achievable under all operating conditions However GE data indicates that NOx and CO may be as high as ppmv during lowload conditions of and lower The permit application represented turbine operations at base load of the time with reduced load operations load occurring no more than of the time The potential to emit calculations presented the emissions in the application in units of lbhr and tonyr These values were accepted by the EPA for the netting analysis and took were taken into account by the EPA See EPA Statement of Basis document Because the permit conditions hold us to ppmvd values and not lbyr or tonyear values Transwestern is concerned that under low load conditions of less than the emissions of NOx and CO would be ppmvd Transwestern is requesting that a provision be made in the permit conditions that emissions of NOx and CO be held to ppmvd during the of the time that the turbines operating conditions is less than or equal to The word Catepillar is mispelled throughout the permit Permit conditions for sulfur testing in the fuel gas requires Transwestern to use methodologies wet chemistry technology that are not normally used to monitor and measure sulfur in the natural gas Transwestern has received approval from the EPA for other custom fuel monitoring schedules to use GPA Standard length of stain tube or gas chromatography as the proposed methodology to monitor sulfur in the natural gas This email is the property of Enron Corp andor its relevant affiliate and may contain confidential and privileged material for the sole use of the intended recipient s Any review use distribution or disclosure by others is strictly prohibited If you are not the intended recipient or authorized to receive for the recipient please contact the sender or reply to Enron Corp at and delete all copies of the message This email and any attachments hereto are not intended to be an offer or an acceptance and do not create or evidence a binding and enforceable contract between Enron Corp or any of its affiliates and the intended recipient or any other party and may not be relied on by anyone as the basis of a contract by estoppel or otherwise Thank you

API Campbell CFR addresses regulations for the transportation of hazardous liquids by pipelines Attached are some of the regs that specify applicability defnitions and tank inspection requirements I dont see any exemptions from the inspection requirements for breakout tanks Let me know if you need more indepth analysis of the DOT regs Jon E Fields REM Argent Consulting Services Inc Ph Fx CFR doc CFR doc

Tank InspectionsCampbell Attached is a summary table showing the inspection types and intervals required by CFR and CFR CFR is a DOT regulation that references API for affected tanks There are no exemptions for age or size The DOT inspections focus on physical integrity of the tank to prevent catostrophic failure The CFR rules are aimed at emissions and these do have age and size limitations Let me know if this is satisfactory or if you need anything else Jon E Fields REM Argent Consulting Services Inc Ph Fx tank reqsxls

Texas Title V Cc Campbell Argent has overnighted Title V renewal applications for Plainview Seminole Brownfield Spraberry WT Keystone Walton and Eldorado Copies have also been sent to Ms Jensen Jon E Fields REM Argent Consulting Services Inc Ph Fx BrownfieldPTExls ELDORADOXLS PlainviewPTExls SeminolePTExls SPRABERptexls WTXLS Waltonxls KEYSTONEXLS

Emission FeesI spoke with Darron Blackburn regarding the Burger Crane and Sonora accounts Darron has told me that the blue fee return sheets indicate that EOTT submitted zero fees for these three accounts Darron indicated that these sites had either NSPS sources or an active Title V permit Therefore fees would be required A fee would not be required if there was no intention of operating the sites in the fiscal year September through August If a fee is owed but the site did not operate in then EOTT would owe the minimum fee If the Title V was not officially terminated prior to Nov then the fee is required if the source operates in the fiscal year Our database shows Burger and Sonora to be out of service Therefore a fiscal year fee would not be required This needs to be communicated to Mr Blackburn in writing Our database shows Crane to have all grandfathered tanks Therefore the only trigger for a fee would be an active Title V permit Do you know if the TNRCC has voided the Title V and if so when Jon E Fields REM Argent Consulting Services Inc Ph Fx

Turbines Cc with Eduardo Acosta at the TNRCC He has stated that if a turbine is not subject to any NSPS or TAC requirements you dont have to list them on an OPUA form Ive prepared the renewals with an OPUA form that makes a negative Subpart GG applicability statement However if you prefer I can remove these forms Having the forms in the permit makes it clear to an inspector that the turbine is grandfathered from GG What is your preference Jon E Fields REM Argent Consulting Services Inc Ph Fx

API Campbell CFR addresses regulations for the transportation of hazardous liquids by pipelines Attached are some of the regs that specify applicability defnitions and tank inspection requirements I dont see any exemptions from the inspection requirements for breakout tanks Let me know if you need more indepth analysis of the DOT regs Jon E Fields REM Argent Consulting Services Inc Ph Fx CFR doc CFR doc

Tank InspectionsCampbell Attached is a summary table showing the inspection types and intervals required by CFR and CFR CFR is a DOT regulation that references API for affected tanks There are no exemptions for age or size The DOT inspections focus on physical integrity of the tank to prevent catostrophic failure The CFR rules are aimed at emissions and these do have age and size limitations Let me know if this is satisfactory or if you need anything else Jon E Fields REM Argent Consulting Services Inc Ph Fx tank reqsxls

Texas Title V Cc Campbell Argent has overnighted Title V renewal applications for Plainview Seminole Brownfield Spraberry WT Keystone Walton and Eldorado Copies have also been sent to Ms Jensen Jon E Fields REM Argent Consulting Services Inc Ph Fx BrownfieldPTExls ELDORADOXLS PlainviewPTExls SeminolePTExls SPRABERptexls WTXLS Waltonxls KEYSTONEXLS

Emission FeesI spoke with Darron Blackburn regarding the Burger Crane and Sonora accounts Darron has told me that the blue fee return sheets indicate that EOTT submitted zero fees for these three accounts Darron indicated that these sites had either NSPS sources or an active Title V permit Therefore fees would be required A fee would not be required if there was no intention of operating the sites in the fiscal year September through August If a fee is owed but the site did not operate in then EOTT would owe the minimum fee If the Title V was not officially terminated prior to Nov then the fee is required if the source operates in the fiscal year Our database shows Burger and Sonora to be out of service Therefore a fiscal year fee would not be required This needs to be communicated to Mr Blackburn in writing Our database shows Crane to have all grandfathered tanks Therefore the only trigger for a fee would be an active Title V permit Do you know if the TNRCC has voided the Title V and if so when Jon E Fields REM Argent Consulting Services Inc Ph Fx

Turbines Cc with Eduardo Acosta at the TNRCC He has stated that if a turbine is not subject to any NSPS or TAC requirements you dont have to list them on an OPUA form Ive prepared the renewals with an OPUA form that makes a negative Subpart GG applicability statement However if you prefer I can remove these forms Having the forms in the permit makes it clear to an inspector that the turbine is grandfathered from GG What is your preference Jon E Fields REM Argent Consulting Services Inc Ph Fx
